The claim was made through multiple post: indicating a widespread announcement of the recruitment process for the Dangote Refinery.
A custom: made bit.ly link was shared, redirecting readers to a page on Nigerian news site ejesgist.com, which purportedly listed job posts available at the refinery. However, the page did not redirect to the official recruitment page of the Dangote Group.
Kadaria Ahmed: a prominent Nigerian journalist, also shared the link on Twitter, leading to further circulation and retweets.
The Dangote Group: as a standard practice, publishes its job openings on its official website and social media accounts. However, there were no recent job openings listed on their website, and the head of corporate communications for the Dangote Group advised disregarding the recruitment claim.
